page.title: 04 SHOPPING IN 1939
page.content: There were more businesses in the Upper Richmond Road then - 280. There were 15 confectioners, 14 provision stores, 13 hairdressers, 10 tailors or outfitters, 7 drapers, 5 dyers and cleaners, 6 chemists, 5 wine shops, 3 laundries, 4 milliners, 4 fishmongers, 4 bakers, 5 greengrocers, 3 decorators, several garages and wireless dealers. Some types of businesses have gone for good -a 'ham and beef' shop, 2 private libraries, 3 dressmakers, a Provident Clothing Club. Some shops are still in the same hands - Hillier (builders), Semmens (hairdressers), Fordyce (electricians), Cross (toys), Melville (estate agents), Victoria Wine Co. There was a Customs and Excise office, and a Day Nursery (!), only 2 antique shops and 2 'dining rooms', and 2 tea-rooms.
